messages: f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (12:21): Hello, why may windows dont ask for username when connetcting to samba share with password
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (12:22): Zafod:  The windows machine probably uses password as the machine you're on.
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (12:24): Speedy2: when autorisation dialog box appear it has a server\Ghost in the username field and i cannot change it
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (12:35): A Windows machine is trying to connect to a UNIX machine with Samba?
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (12:35): Zafod: Can you be more clean on your setup?
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (12:36): Speedy2: Yes windows XP machine tryes to connect server with samba
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (12:37): Speedy2: Maybe problem with security=share?
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:01): Zafod:  How are you trying to connect to the machine?  Try going to a command prompt and typing: "start \\<ip_address_of_machine" (without quotes)
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (13:06): Speedy2: i typed start \\10.1.1.88 and it show me 2 shares
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:06): Ok...try opening one of those shares
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (13:07): Speedy2: when i try to open share "epu" authorisation dialog box appears
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (13:10): Speedy2: and this dialog box don't let change the username
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:16): Zafod:  What user are you logged in as?  Can you login to the XP machine as Administrator?
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (13:17): Speedy2: I'm logged as administrator
f44310a42bf987639a52aa70befc21e2 (13:29): ||cw: hello, alive pal?
9965efbc03804690f4a37bf441d03176 (13:37): from my config file, i cannot connect to MSHOME http://rafb.net/paste/results/PeiQRN66.html
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:40): Zafod:  Sorry no ideas!  Reboot the machine?
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:40): Zafod:  I use Win2000 and don't have that problem.
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (13:41): Speedy2: i tryed this on 3 diffrent machines, problem persists
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:42): What OS?
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:43): They all have "administrator" for the login?
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:43): Do the Samba machines have the same names/shares as other Windows machines on your network?
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (13:45): Speedy2: they all have administrative rights
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:46): When you try to open a Samba share, what user name appears?
58ed511dbe7cc6f90a7d866cd802a2b6 (13:46): That is bizarre.
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (13:50): Speedy2: i tryed to connect to the server from unix via smbclient and no matter what login i use it authorise me to open the share
f70814468f3c6c95238d08183036db78 (13:50): Speedy2: but the password still need to be correct
b5c66414b004e17b421d0991e52c753b (13:55): I'm using samba with ldap, and it's getting too long to star (like 2min). What can be wrong?
36492df2b95eaf897cb70c2d84df191f (13:56): esci, anything showing up in the logs?
f44310a42bf987639a52aa70befc21e2 (13:56): anyone here willing to help me with openssh+ads auth?
36492df2b95eaf897cb70c2d84df191f (13:57): esci, tail -f log.smbd and start samba up that way you see what's going on
9965efbc03804690f4a37bf441d03176 (14:00): anyone see anything wrong with my config file?
b5c66414b004e17b421d0991e52c753b (14:00): tiny: it justs sais that Samba has been started
b5c66414b004e17b421d0991e52c753b (14:00): also, smbldap-useradd -a -m -P testuser takes so long too to start
36492df2b95eaf897cb70c2d84df191f (14:02): esci, try googling it out

9965efbc03804690f4a37bf441d03176 (14:26): ;   passdb backend = tdbsam
